intro: Sium aromaticum, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to wetlands and moist areas of North America and Eurasia. The plant has a distinct, aromatic scent and features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. The root is edible but often has a strong, unpleasant taste.
